answers.answer: You may need a CT scan of your chest and a nuclear stress test for your heart.  Talk to your doctor.

question: I had a chest injury where my wife knocked me on my left chest with a huge rock.  I couldn't breathe at the time and was sick for a few days with shortness of breath and chest pains.  Now I get severe chest pains in my left chest which extends to my shoulders and back and find it hard to breath (painful if I take deep breathes).  That was 8 years ago and now its becoming frequent and the pain is getting worse.  Medical x-rays reveal that I have an enlarge liver or lung (not sure which). I drink alcohol and am a smoker as well. Please recommend what types of medical checkup I should requests as I have no idea.  Haven't had any medication apart from pain killers.  My mum is also diagnosed with diabetes.
title: Severe chest pains after chest injury
